newsitem.title: USA: Libbey sees growth in sales, profits.
newsitem.headline: Libbey sees growth in sales, profits.

text.p: Tableware producer Libbey Inc on Wednesday anticipated growth in sales, profits and cash flow during the second half of 1997.
"We are seeing the benefits of our re-engineering program in our factories and are expecting growth in sales, profits and cash flow as we proceed through 1997," said chief executive John Meier.
Libbey's sales in the second quarter of 1997 increased to $104.0 million from $103.8 million a year earlier.
Net income, meanwhile, increased 16.4 percent to $10.1 million, or $0.65 per share, from $8.7 million, or $0.56 per share, for the year-ago period.
